newsitem.title: CHINA: China chemical industry eyes foreign investment.
newsitem.headline: China chemical industry eyes foreign investment.

text.p: China's chemical industry plans to open its domestic market further to foreign companies over the next five years, the China News Service on Tuesday quoted a senior official as saying.

"In some cooperation fields, China is willing to give out partial domestic market share in exchange for foreign advanced technology," Chen Shineng, vice-minister at the Chemical Industry Ministry, told a news conference on Monday.
Firms introducing badly needed chemical products and advanced equipment could also apply for enjoying preferential import policies, Chen said.
China hoped to achieve new breakthroughs in joint venture projects to produce such substances as polyformaldehyde, MDI, organosilicon and organofluorine, he said.
China would set up 15 large-scale chemical group firms and production bases for exports in the Ninth Five-Year Plan (1996-2000), he said but gave no details.
Total foreign trade volume of the chemical industry this year exceeded $30 billion, he said without elaborating.
